text: Draft at Funky Buddha. Pours a hazy yellow color and topped by a small off white head of foam that slettles quickly to a thin film. The aroma shows huge notes of tart key limes, vanilla cream, lactic sourness, and pie crust. Smells pretty damn close to key lime pie. The flavor follows suit and shows plenty of tart key lime, crisp wheat, vanilla cream, some pie crust, and plenty of lactic sourness. Medium bodied with ample carbonation that leads to a clean, crisp, tart key lime finish. They nailed what they were going for on this one. Easy drinking and refreshing and perfect for a hot summer day. Really well done Berliner Weiss.
Verde/amarelado claro de leve turbidez, espuma rala de pouca formação e persistência. Limão do início ao fim, médio azedo e leve dulçor, remeteu a suco artificial em pó. Esperava bem mais.

My Bottom Line:
Generous lime and its acidity are met by precise salt and sugar in this pleasant ceviche-invoking Berliner Weisse.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam circles the whitish blond.
-The smooth bubbling due to the Western tap serving doesnt help the mouthfeel that much. Would have helped if it were more effervescent, or drier-feeling.
-This actually drinks like a real Berliner though, so extra points for dosage with the adjuncts! This beer doesnt feel artificial (contrary to their Maple Bacon Coffee Porter).
-Extra point also for pulling off this high level of drinkability (oysters, lime juice, lactobacillus, authenticity nonetheless, etc.).

On tap at the brewery tasting room.
Cloudy, pale tan. Bit perfumey, tart, sweet key lime character is cute, a little goofy but pretty refreshing.

Draft. Medium white head atop cloudy apple juice body. Aroma is medium sweet, lime, tart - really, Key Lime pie. Taste is medium sweet, Key lime pie, light perfume//flower, sourness. Light body, light acidity.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey for the Cigar City & Funky Buddha SAVOR event. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of big key limes. Tastes of key lime, vanilla, tart notes. Almost like a key lime pie. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Really good.
Wonderful stuff. Subtle, well integrated and still exactly what it promises. Pours hazy blonde with OK head. Light clean finish. Light yeast. Subtle and understated. Tap at Churchkey.

On tap at Funky Buddha poured a cloudy gold with a small lasting white head. Aromas of wheat, key lime and light vanilla. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry lightly tart finish. Flavors of wheat, key lime and light vanilla with a crisp dry lightly tart lingering key lime finish.
On tap at Hullabaloo. Cloudy yellow pour with a fleeting white head. Mild citrus bouquet. Tangy with loads of key lime notes. A bit one dimensional with malty backbeats. Average body and mouthfeel.

sample @ EBF 2015. unclear pale golden pour with a small white cap, some retention and lacing. obvious lime and other citrus - perfumey bergamot perhaps, hint of sweetness - ripened green apples and floral honey, light acidity - mainly lactic but not really supporting enough sweetness. average carboantion, light body - oily; lightly tart and herbal-grassy-lime-y finish. nice bit borderline artificial.

EBF
Pours hazy blond with low white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of fruits, weird vanilla, spices, candies. Taste is of sourness, fruits, citrus, salt. Palate: Light-medium body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Quite good. Maybe too spicy?

Sample @ EBF.

Appearance: Hazy pale yellow golden with a small white head and little lacing. 

Aroma: Lime and lemon forward with nice spicy features, meringue and lactic notes. 

Taste: Lime and lemon and spices/cinnamon, mild tartness, lactic notes and meringue sweetness/sugary presence.

Palate: Light to medium body. Moderate carbonation. Never watery. Lingering lime and spicy (mild to moderate) finish. 

Overall: Super tasty Berliner Weisse, maybe even a tad too flavorful. Its still quite drinkable despite all the flavors. Like many Funky Buddha beers, its so close to the real taste they are trying to reproduce that it feels borderline artificial, but again here it stays acceptable... and so damn tasty.

Sample at EBF. Hazy white gold pour with almost no head. Aroma has lots of lemon, lime, citrusy and citric, nothing really showcasing lime per se, pretty standard berliner aroma, that being said it smells really nice, a bit of spice, maybe a hint of curry. Flavor is tart, lemony, very nice, lime, coconut. Palate is light, dry, light carbonation. Good stuff.
Really awesome. Light and drinkable for the high abv (within style) and tastes just like key lime pie without the bracing sourness of some fruited berliners.
Really cool pie beer. Tastes like key lime pie with pie crusts lime and tartness. There beers dont tastes like beer and i dont care.
draft. pours yellow white head. Nose/taste of lactose, lime, lemon, light pie crust and sour funk. lighter medium body.

Draft at EBf, great call Erin. Pours a cloudy golden color with a small white head. Aroma is of tart/sweet key lime pie, straight up right down to the Graham cracker crust. Taste is the same, great balance of tart and sweet key lime pie, pie crust, Sweet. This was a standout!
Draft at EBF. Light yellow pour with white lacing. Citrus and key lime aromas, tart tones and sourness. Flavors are key lime and tart Berliner tones.
Tap. Golden yellow with small head. Big lime flavor with a mild tartness. Light vanilla. Outstanding.
Hazy yellow pour. Nose is funk, cheese, tart citrus. Taste is cheesy funk and key lime pie. I really get some pie crust and vanilla in here, very impressive. Light sticky mouthfeel.

Tap at MBCP. I ran around all day looking for Berliners with no luck until this one. It did not disappoint. Pour was hazy golden orange, some lacing and head. Aroma was pure key lime pie with a hint of lemony tartness. Flavor was light plus tart with a wonderful key lime taste meld that really did remind me of a pie. Really good. (This beer rocks! :))
Draft at MBCP. A very tropical like aroma with a punch of tartness. Flavor is the same with a very puckering tartness. Lime is well done. Almost even has a subtle creaminess too it. Solid.
pale hazy white/yellow.  Aroma of lime and spices, slight ginger.  taste is very sour, lime all the way.  nice over the top sour berliner

Draft at Monks Cafe in Philadelphia, PA. 

Pours a hazy ecto cooler/booger green color with a half finger off-white head that immediately fades away. No retention or lacing. Doesnt look very good. 

The aroma of this beer is pretty crazy. Smells more like a dessert beer with lots of tart lime/citrus, subtle lactic funk and even some whip cream. Smells just like pie but not really like a typical Berliner Weiss. Pretty intense but almost artificial. Still, they nailed what they were going for. 

Medium bodied with soft carbonation and a very sweet and tart lime presence. Again, it tastes very close to the dessert with lots of tart lime and whip cream but this slightly overpowers the characteristics of the style. Decent amount of sourness but only subtle lactic funk and some faint sourdough bread flavor. Really good but could have been legendary if it wasnt as one dimensional.

On draft at Pegs for the Berliner Bash. Pours a cloudy light yellow with almost zero head. The aroma was of limes and slight malt  and grain. The taste is limes for sure a touch of tartness with not much else.

On tap at the Pegs Berliner Bash.  Served in a mini snifter.  Pours a light Ecto Cooler color with a short white head.  Nose has a good dose of sour lime and accompanying peel.  Nice wheat in the background of the flavor.  Lime element is really nice and fits the style quite well.  Light and dry with slight acidity.  Really pleasant.

On tap at Monks.  Murky grapefruit juice with white froth.  Smells like a lime mousse.  Creamy medium light with a refreshing spritz.  Taste is tart concentrated lime  juice, toned down a bit with sweet and sour apple, finishing with hints of graham cracker and cinnamon.  Love the creativity of this one.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2012 Glass from James during the shit show that was Funky Buddha at Monks this year. Thanks for passsing this one back to me brah. Pours hazy golden straw color with massive fluffy white head that dissipated quickly. Aromas and taste started out with mostly tart lime and alot of cinnamon, other notes of vanilla cream, lemonade, sour berliner yeasts. Such a unique and cool beer, thanks for bringing it to Philly Ryan.

On tap at Monks.  Pours a hazed yellow gold with a medium sized white head.  Cinnamon, lime peel, graham cracker crust.   Medium bodied, lime and light acid.  Toast, faint lactic acid.  Bright acid with lingering lime zest and another helping of cinnamon.  I liked this, but it was probably my least favorite of the four Berliner Weisses they had at the event, and solely because of the cinnamon overpowering things.

Tap at Pegs for Berliner Bash. Full hazed white pour. Nose is rich, super tangy key lime, fresh and zippy, whipped cream and pie crust. Some dessert profile. Wow. Taste is super tart, whoa, key lime pulp and peel. Super tart. Big tartaric/mallic acid. Big lactic acid. Absolutely delicious.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2012 Draft at Pegs during the Berliner Bash 2012. Pours a creamy, beige body with thin white lacing. Aroma is fresh key lime, crust, and funk. Mouthfeel is tart and mouthpuckering with notes of key lime pie, fresh delicious limes, funky fruit, and a nice aggressive tartness. Amazing.

Draft at Pegs. Cloudy yellow white, the color of Turkish Raki in water with a squeeze of lemon. Aroma of freshly baked pie crust, lime, armpits (in a good way).  Taste is funky lime and biscuits. Very nice.

On draft at Funky Buddha.  Pours a white grapefruit juice color with a white head.  Nose is prickly- key lime juice with a slight fruit sweetness in an ocean of tartness.  Flavor does not disappoint either- tartness, all of the tart and citric tartness of a berliner with slight sweetness and key lime juice to prop it up.  Full in body for a berliner, and all around a thing of beauty.

Draught @ Brewvival.  Hazy straw yellow pour with a fizzy white head.  To quote a friend, this smelled "like champagne out of Athenas vagina".  Lots of tart key limes, light bready malt but overwhelming key lime.  Smelled wonderful.  They captured the true essence of key limes throughout the flavors in this one.  I remembered being wowed multiple times by this one during the fest.

Draft at Brewvival under "Ich Bin Lime Berliner." Pours a hazy straw yellow with not much of a head. Aroma of lime, bready malts and some grain. The taste is very tart limes with not much else. Medium bodied.

On draft at the Funky Buddha, pours a pale key lime color with virtually no head what so ever.  Aromas of tart limes, vanilla, gramcracker, and a smidge of spice.  As soon as I had the first sip it tasted like the key lime pie my fiance makes.  The second sip was more keylime and noticed the gramcraker flavoring, and more key lime.  I normally do not like berliner due to the sourness of the beer, however this one was simply amazing, and out of this world.  Really wish I could get a growler of this to bring back to the Tampa crew.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2012 Draft This beer rocks! Cloudy straw-colored ale with no head. The aroma is a fruity, acidic swirl of big key lime, faint cinnamon, mild vanilla and a trace of graham. Medium-bodied and very creamy with airy carbonation. The flavor is fruity and as sour as Hell. Loads of delicious key lime and heavy, yeasty acidity. Crisp, tart, clean finish. God, I love key lime pie and this captures it with scary precision. World class Berliner weisse!

#700
This was referred to as Key Lime Pie and that is pretty dead on. Nose is insanely awesome. Juicy Key Lime, some light graham cracker (how did they do that??) and some vanilla creme. The appearance I had to give a 5 cause it looks like key lime pie. Color is perfect dead on. Flavor is big super puckery key limes up front with a good hit of vanilla and graham crackery malt (seriously..how?). Finishes fairly sour. Amazing beer. One of my favorites from the Buddha.

On draft for Funky Buddhas 1 year anniversary party. Another treatment that I was really surprised with. Not only did the key lime shine but I got a nice whiff of vanilla and a subtle hint of cinnamon. Being in FL Key Lime pie is a staple around here and the Buddha crew nailed it with this one.
